jarrayliterals
Class ArrayShortcuts

java.lang.Object
  jarrayliterals.ArrayShortcuts

public class ArrayShortcuts
extends java.lang.Object

Shortcuts for creating arbitrary arrays (e.g. for parameterized unit tests).

This class has an overloaded method $(T...): T[]. The method is used for creating an array of a generic element type and expects a non-zero, variable amount of arguments.

This class has also fields that start with $. The fields represent zero-sized arrays of a specific element type.

Note that both the methods and fields return boxed wrapper arrays instead of their respective, primitive data type arrays. 

 $null     null
 $         Object[0]
 $B        Byte[0]
 $S        Short[0]
 $I        Integer[0]
 $L        Long[0]
 $F        Float[0]
 $D        Double[0]
 $b        Boolean[0]
 $c        Char[0]
There are also shortcut methods which automatically cast int arguments to Bytes $B(int...): Byte[] or shorts $S(int...): Short[]. Be careful that these 2 methods trade performance for brevity.

There is also an utility method toString which prints anything (including multidimensional arrays).

Be sure to use $null instead of the regular null when nesting arrays.

Author:
mucaho

Method Detail

toString

public static <T> java.lang.String toString(T arr)
Prints a generic object or generic single-/multi-dimensional array. In essence prints anything (as long as it has the toString() implemented).

Numbers are suffixed with the first capital letter of their respective types.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
arr - anything
Returns:
String representation of arr

$

public static <T> T[] $(T param)
Shortcut for returning a generic-typed, variable-dimension array of Ts. All parameters T passed to this method are returned in an array T[]. Note that the parameters themselves can be arrays.

Parameters:
param - Values to be returned in an T[] array.
Returns:
Values passed to this method.

$

public static <T> java.lang.Object $(T... params)
Shortcut for returning a generic-typed, variable-dimension array of Ts. All parameters T passed to this method are returned in an array T[]. Note that the parameters themselves can be arrays.

Parameters:
params - Values to be returned in an T[] array.
Returns:
Values passed to this method.

$B
